DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if fractional carbon dioxide laser treatment of a fresh wound at the time of surgery, decreases scar formation. Scar revision is commonly done at 6-10 weeks following surgery. Therefore, it may be more beneficial, for both the patient and physician, to perform scar revision at the time of surgery.
DOC.brief_title: The Effects of Fractional Carbon Dioxide (CO2) Laser Treatment Prior to Wound Closure
DOC.criteria: Undergoing skin cancer surgery Will have a straightline incision Fluent in English Must reside in the Los Angeles vicinity for the duration of the study NonEnglish speakers Pregnant or cognitively impaired subjects
